ratings.comment: I don't think you'll ever find a professor who cares more about their students than Fu. The textbook for the class had no examples and was written by the other professor, Fu gave 4 other textbook reccomendations before the class started. Despite what other reviews say his accent is not hard to understand, however, his handwritting is another story.

If you took calc in high school and understood it you'll be just fine. Tests were IDENTICAL to reviews. Especially the final, where he even let us bring a study sheet for the exam. I ended with an A and went to lecture maybe 5 times the entire semester. Discussion was mandatory, though. There was no curve. He was better than other profs.

If you haven't taken calc before, I wouldn't recommend him. There is a prominent language barrier, and his handwriting can be illegible. Despite his efforts, he can't really explain his work and having a TA who can helps a lot. However, his quizzes and exams are fair to the course and there are a lot of grading safety nets.

Lectures are so useless, it's insane. You just can't understand him and follow his work. He also makes lecture videos that are just a black screen with the audio of the real lecture. You just get to hear him do problems that you can't see.

Shubin really cares about his students. He will listen to our feedback and is doing his best. However, the only reason I am doing semi-ok in this class is because I did calc in hs. This would be extremely difficult had I not come in with some baseline knowledge. All of the TAs were slightly difficult to work with. Weekly quizzes. 3 exams.

Best of luck to anyone that dares to take this class. We love Shubin but learning from him is not for everyone, while he can be hard to understand at all times he also doesn't explain his work. I would recommend doing everything in the book as well as attending some lectures and you may be able to scrape by. Good luck. ps. he has good fashion

This guy is trying his best, you can tell. His lectures were horrible at first but I kept showing up and he's gotten MUCH better. It's hard to understand him sometimes and his handwriting might be a mess but both the 211 profs are equally bad. Just gotta make do and read the textbook. Highly recommend group tutoring because it has helped me so much

He cares a lot about the students but just an awful teacher. His lectures just aren't helpful and his hand writing is very difficult to read. It's hard as a student to learn in the class. However he does make it easier by making the grading easy. However I would never take this class again.

Shubin tries, but at a college level trying is not enough. His lectures are pointless, I haven't gone since September. I have had to teach myself the past 3 units and will probably fail this next exam. Disappointed that a college like UW Madison has a teacher worse than my high school (of 200 kids) teacher.

Shubin Fu. His lectures are horrible, I haven't been in 2.5 months, but discussions are perfect. His notes go along with the textbook, so it is so easy to follow along. He creates worksheets every discussion which are easy to understand. His tests are just like the review sheets. Much easier than the other Math 211 teachers, just ask for help!
This guy is the worst teacher I have had in my life. He has no clue how to teach math in a way that other students can understand it
Does not speak well, moans in the mic, getting better feel a little bad for him but yea needs to work this thing out.

Shubin is sweet? Not a good teacher. He knows the material very well but he does not teach at all and he does not speak english very well. He moans during lecture, and I do better when I read the textbook then when I go to his lectures. If you can find someone else for this class, do it. Plus the exams are all but 20% of your grade.

Shubin definitely needs to work on his lectures, but heres the thing: he is. Like others have said hes getting better with lectures, and he genuinely is trying. And on top of that, hes a super nice guy. Email him with questions if you need help hes pretty good about responding. Having trouble during the lecture? Follow along in the textbook.

Has made great progress since the beginning of the semester. I believe he is new, but he is much easier to understand and his lectures are comprehensible than compared to the beginning of the sem. Lectures move at a pace that is easier to understand.

SHUBIN is passionate about mathematics. He prepares fantastic notes. He cares a lot of his students and provides lots of office hours. There are also many TAs to help shubin answer our questions. We could also learn from TAs.

SHUBIN is truly a nice professor trying his best. Mathematics is usually a little bit boring but Shubin uses enough examples to make basic theories easier. Everytime I ask him questions, he always gives me good feedback, ensuring me to understand it thoroughly.

Professor FU is very responsible for our class. Sometimes there were tech issues but he always tried everything he could do to maintain the whole class normally, which was valuable characteristics for a new professor in UW-Madison. Basic concepts and equations are useful for further study and math211 helps me quite solid foundation.

Math 211 is an introductory math course and Shubin did well in explaining basic concepts. He gave many helpful examples in each lecture so that those concepts are no longer abstract. Also, his lectures covered nearly everything on the textbook so I didn't need to read the textbook anymore. Overall he's a good lecturer and I would take again.
Shubin Fu is a wonderful guy. Would take again

Avoid this prof at all costs. Math211 is an introductory math class and going in, I thought it wouldnt be bad but just after the 1st lecture, I knew I would need extra help. Big language gap with Fu, its hard to understand him. He rushes lectures, doesnt explain, and neglects question. Try to find a different prof cause Shubin Fu aint it...

Just started taking math 211 with Fu and he really shouldnt be able to teach. He is unorganized, very frantic/panicky during lectures (ex: tech issues), and doesnt explain the material as he goes. He just copies the examples straight from the book. He tries to cram in the entire lecture in 50 minutes and shrugs off our questions/concerns
He barely explains anything during class, and when he does he usually uses the wrong variables. You will have to read the book to make up for the confusing taught during lectures.

I took this class online so take this with a grain of salt. The lectures were asynchronous and useless. He would just go over the reading from the textbook. Prepare to learn a lot of the material yourself. The exam was ripped straight from the textbook.

Awful explanations and uses everything straight from the textbook in short, fragmented clips of actual, useful information. Although it is difficult to speak English after speaking a language of Asian origin, the professor did nothing to clarify what he was actually saying and it was a chore to understand what he was saying in the first place

Not my favourite professor. Lecture notes are basically textbook trimmings. You will be dependent on your TAs for this class. Homework and quizzes are fine, but the final exam was too long. Fun fact: on the first day, there about 130 students attending his lecture, but by the end of the semester, there were only 20 students attending each time.

Stay away, easily the worst professor Ive ever had. He is an absolute waste of tuition, even my worst high school teacher was better. Hes literally an audiobook, just reads straight from the textbook for the entire lecture. Gives 0 geometric/intuitive explanations. Copies exam questions straight from textbook. Save yourself the trouble.

Very bad experience. Just read out of the textbook and assigned questions out of it for the exam. Especially on the final the questions were way too long to be completed during the time given, especially w/o a calculator. If you take the class w/ him prepare to teach yourself or get a ton of help from the TA's.
